intro: Sisymbrium acutangulum, commonly known as the sharp-angled shepherd's purse, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbages. The plant produces small, triangular seed pods that are often used in herbal medicine. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its flowers are white or pale purple, and it blooms from spring to early summer.
